channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2025010424
item.description:
Report X-2025010424

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=423532996090 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN3265 CLASS=80 QTY UOM=Liquid - Gallon PSN TEXT=Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic, n.o.s. PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Gallon MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Gallon TECH NAME=(HYDROXY ACETIC ACID) )Spill. 2 Undeclared Hazmats. One 1gal plastic bottle Zep Mold/mildew stain remover lost 4oz from loose cap. 1gal bottle Zep Shower Tub Tile Cleaner also included. Nonhaz: 1gal bottle of Zep premium carpet shampoo & 1gal bottle Odoban 3-in-1 Carpet cleaner. No orientation arrows. Box height is 7.5". Bottles height is 12.5"

item.title: Report X-2025010351
item.description:
Report X-2025010351

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-31
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the MEMH spill office. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal bucket in a plastic bag sealed with a zip tie and bubble wrap for dunnage. The lid of the bucket came open spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025010350

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that the plastic bucket inside was damaged on the bottom causing a release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024121344
item.description:
Report X-2024121344

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 22nd a package was found during hte AM sort that was completely crushed causing the entire contents to leak out. The package was marked as UN1824, SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION, 8, II.. The spill was cleaned up and the residual packaging was put into a steel salvage drum and sent out for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010052
item.description:
Report E-2025010052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HONEYWELL INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Team was conducting an HF anhydrous offload. Immediately after establishing flow, team noticed HF coming from top of offload line connection. Team immediately pressed E-stop and blocked in the nitrogen. The operator activated the safety mitigation system. After the mitigation system was deactivated, the line was swept, new gasket installed, leak check performed, and product was safely offloaded.
